pageProps.title: The Measure of Success: Rethinking Human Evolution and Flourishing
pageProps.metaDesc: Traditionally, the measure of success in the evolutionary context has been attributed to a species' ability to adapt, grow, and endure over time. By that definition, humans can be considered highly successful, with a global population of over 8 billion individuals. However, when we take a closer look, it becomes evident that this conventional notion of success fails to capture the complex realities we face today. Amidst a backdrop of widespread human suffering and the degradation of our planet, it becomes imperative to reevaluate our understanding of evolutionary success and explore the concept of human flourishing. This article delves into the multifaceted aspects of success, challenges the prevailing arguments about human progress, and highlights the importance of collective well-being in shaping our evolutionary trajectory.
